captions.text:
TODAY I'M GONNA ANNOUNCE
OFFICIALLY THAT I'LL BE

HOSTING A NEW SHOW FOR
C-SPAN CALLED
"HATEWATCH WITH JON STEWART."

(CHEERS AND APPLAUSE)
HERE'S A SNEAK PREVIEW.

>> COMING UP NEXT ON C-SPAN 2
JON STEWART LOOKS AT CONGRESS IN
C-SPAN'S NEW SHOW, "HATEWATCH."

THEN AT 11:30 P.M., ON BOOK TV,
AUTHOR MICHIO KAKU DISCUSSES THE

CHALLENGES OF WRITING A MEMOIR
WHEN THERE'S A BEE TRAPPED IN
YOUR OFFICE.
>> HI, EVERYBODY.

WELCOME TO "HATEWATCH" ON C-SPAN
2, I'M JON STEWART.

WHY DON'T WE TAKE A LOOK TODAY
AND SEE WHAT OUR CONGRESS IS UP
TO?

>> A BIPARTISAN BILL TO PROVIDE
ASSISTANCE TO HUMAN TRAFFICKING

VICTIMS AND ADDITIONAL RESOURCES
TO LAW ENFORCEMENT HAS GOTTEN
STUCK IN THE SENATE.

>> Jon: MOTHER -- SO IT APPEARS
THE SENATE IS STUCK ON A BILL

I'M SURE EVERY AMERICAN WHO'S
NOT CURRENTLY ACTIVELY INVOLVED

IN TRAFFICKING HUMANS FOR
SEX WOULD SUPPORT.

THAT SOUNDS LIKE SOMETHING I
WOULD HATE.
TELL ME MORE.

>> DEMOCRATS HAD JOINED
REPUBLICANS IN UNANIMOUS SUPPORT

OF THE BILL IN COMMITTEE BUT ARE
NOW FIGHTING TO STRIP
OUT HYDE AMENDMENT LANGUAGE.

>> Jon: AH YES, THE HYDE
AMENDMENT, NAMED FOR THE ACTION

THAT REPUBLICANS APPARENTLY HAVE
TO TAKE TO GET THE ANTI-ABORTION

LANGUAGE INTO ALL BILLS. LET'S
HIDE IT OVER HERE, LET'S HIDE IT

OVER -- THE HYDE AMENDMENT
BLOCKS THE USE OF FEDERAL MONEY

FOR ABORTIONS, BECAUSE JUST
BECAUSE A PROCEDURE IS

COMPLETELY LEGAL DOESN'T MEAN IT
HAS TO BE TREATED THAT WAY.

I SEE WHAT'S HAPPENED, A LITTLE
BIT OF REPUBLICAN WHAT WE AT
C-SPAN TWO CALL (BLEEP)RY.

HOW DID THE SEX TRAFFICKING BILL
GET PASSED COMMITTEE

WITHOUT ANY NOT REPUBLICANS
COMPLAINING.

>> DEMOCRATS DO ADMIT THAT WHEN
THIS BILL WENT THROUGH THE

SENATE JUDICIARY COMMITTEE
AND WAS APPROVED BY BOTH
DEMOCRATS AND REPUBLICANS,
THEY DIDN'T READ IT FULLY.

>> Jon: YOU DIDN'T READ IT
FULLY.

WHAT, DID YOU JUST SKIM IT TO
SEE IF YOUR NAME WAS MENTIONED?
MOM!
I'M IN THE BILL!

>> WE DIDN'T KNOW IT WAS IN THE
BILL.

YOU CAN BLAME IT ON STAFF, BLAME
IT ON WHOEVER YOU WANT TO BLAME
IT ON.

>> Jon: HOW ABOUT I BLAME NOT
READING THE BILL ON YOU?

SENATOR HARRY REID, THE GUY IN
CHARGE OF SENATE DEMOCRATS WHOSE
LAST NAME IS LITERALLY" REID ."
HOW DID YOU NOT READ THIS BILL?

IT'D BE LIKE GOING TO JOHN
WATERS' HOUSE AND FINDING OUT
ALL OF HIS PLANTS ARE DEAD.

JOHN, WHY DIDN'T YOU YOUR LAST
NAME THEM!

WELL, IT APPEARS (BLEEP)ERY AND
DUMBASSERY ARE RUNNING NECK

AND NECK TO STYMIE THE HUMAN SEX
TRAFFICKING BILL
EVERYONE AGREES SHOULD BE A LAW.

AS REPRESENTED HERE BY SAID
(BLEEP) AND DUMBASSES.

>> A REPUBLICAN JUDICIARY
COMMITTEE STAFFER SENT A

DEMOCRATIC STAFFER A SUMMARY
OF CHANGES TO THE PREVIOUS

VERSION OF THE BILL IN SEVEN
BULLET POINTS.
GUESS WHAT.

THEY LEFT OUT THE CHANGE THEY
MADE.

>> REPUBLICANS ANNOUNCING THAT
TRUSTING THEM WAS A MISTAKE.
>> Jon: REALLY? YOU THINK?

YOU THINK THAT TRUSTING THE
REPUBLICANS WAS A MISTAKE
YOU KNOW WHO THAT'S ON?

IT'S THE SAME WAY NOBODY BLAMES
THE BEARS IN "GRIZZLY MAN" FOR

EATING THE DELICIOUS-LOOKING
MEAT SACK WHO KEPT STICKING HIS

HANDS IN THEIR POOP.
BECAUSE THEY'RE BEARS.

YOU KNOW WHAT, PERHAPS
NOW IT'S TIME ON

"HATEWATCH" TO GO TO THE
PHONES.

>> "HATEWATCH" PHONE
CALLS SPONSORED BY ARBY'S.

ARBY'S, BRINGING
WASHINGTON-STYLE GRIDLOCK
TO YOUR COLON.

>> Jon: JUST CALL THE NUMBER
ON YOUR SCREEN, CALL TO GET IN

ON OUR -- 
(LAUGHTER)

IT LOOKS LIKE WE HAVE OUR FIRST
CALLER.

NOW OBVIOUSLY SINCE THIS IS
C-SPAN THE CALLER WILL PROBABLY

BE A NON-SCREENED, UNAPOLOGETIC
RACIST. LET'S TAKE A LOOK.
YOU'RE ON THE AIR.

>> Caller: JON, CLEARLY THE
PROBLEM HERE IS BLACK PEOPLE

DON'T HAVE AN AMERICAN WORK
ETHIC AND CAN'T REALLY

UNDERSTAND CIVILIZATION, SO AS
LONG AS PRESIDENT BROKE O'BUMMER

IS IN OFFICE OPPRESSING WHITE
PEOPLE --
>> Jon: OKAY GOODBYE.

LET'S RETURN TO OUR EXAMINATION
OF HOW A BIPARTISAN SEX

TRAFFICKING BILL IS STUCK IN THE
SENATE.

I BELIEVE MAJORITY LEADER MITCH
MCCONNELL WOULD LIKE TO MAKE
A DISINGENUOUS POINT.

>> LET'S NOT FILIBUSTER
BIPARTISAN HELP FOR VULNERABLE

VICTIMS JUST TO MAKE A POINT FOR
LEFT-WING SPECIAL INTEREST
GROUPS.

>> Jon: HOW DARE -- THE ONLY
REASON THE LANGUAGE IS IN THERE

IS BECAUSE YOU'RE BOWING DOWN TO
RIGHT-WING SPECIAL INTEREST --
YOU KNOW, SON OF A BITCH!

I WANNA -- LET ME TELL YOU
SOMETHING!
TURTLE MAN!

I, YOU KNOW WHAT -- I JUST, I
NEED A MOMENT.
I NEED A MOMENT.

>> UP NEXT WE'LL TRAIN OUR
CAMERAS ON AN EMPTY PODIUM LONG

BEFORE ANYONE APPROACHES
IT TO SPEAK.

>> Jon: ALL RIGHT. I'M OKAY, I'M
OKAY. ALL RIGHT.

UNLESS SENATOR MCCONNELL IS
ABOUT TO IN THE IMMEDIATE

AFTERMATH OF COMPLAINING THAT
THE DEMOCRATS ARE USING AN

UNRELATED ISSUE TO HOLD UP
IMPORTANT SENATE BUSINESS --

HOLD UP IMPORTANT SENATE
BUSINESS WITH AN UNRELATED
ISSUE.

>> SENATE MAJORITY LEADER MITCH
MCCONNELL SAYS HE WILL PUT OFF A

CONFIRMATION VOTE ON ATTORNEY
GENERAL NOMINEE LORETTA LYNCH

UNTIL THE SENATE PASSES A HUMAN
TRAFFICKING BILL.

>> Jon: YOU'RE DOING THE
SAME THING -- HELP!
HELP! HELP!

>> WE NOW REJOIN LIVE A
REENACTMENT OF A CIVIL WAR
BOOK PANEL.
>> BLAH, BLAH, BLAH GETTYSBURG.

>> OH SO WITTY, NORTH FREEDOM,
BLAH, BLAH, BLAH,

>> LOOK AT MY HAIR, I'M SO
OLD I WEAR A BOW TIE!
>> FASCINATING...

>> Jon: ALL RIGHT. WELL,
IT APPEARS THE FAILURE OF THE
SEX TRAFFICKING BILL TO PASS

THE SENATE WOULD SEAL THE
VICTORY FOR (BLEEP)RY IN THIS

CASE BUT WE WON'T SURE UNTIL THE
VOTE ON THE

SENATE FLOOR ACCOMPANIED BY
CLASSICAL MUSIC TO MAKE YOU FEEL
SMART.

(MUSIC)
>> Jon: ACTUALLY, YOU KNOW

WHAT, THIS IS JUST
TAKING TOO LONG.

I'M GONNA MAKE ANOTHER
ANNOUNCEMENT.

SIX AND A HALF MINUTES AGO,
C-SPAN 2 GAVE ME AN INCREDIBLE
OPPORTUNITY TO HOST THIS SHOW.

BUT I THINK NOW IT'S TIME FOR
SOMEONE ELSE, ANYONE ELSE.

"HATEWATCH" DOESN'T DESERVE A
HOST WHO'S EVEN SLIGHTLY
NAUSEOUS.

NOW I DON'T KNOW WHEN I'LL BE
LEAVING "HATEWATCH."
OH YES, I DO.
RIGHT (BLEEP) NOW.
WOW!

title: The Daily Show - Hatewatch with Jon Stewart

comments.text:
From a purely comedic perspective, this entire bit was more funny than all 
of Jon's episodes from 2014-2015 combined, they really seem to lose it when 
they aren't in a presidential election season, their stuff from 2011-2013 
is pretty good, but lately their 2014-2015 has gotten stale, boring, lazy, 
and feels more like a chore than inspired comedy. 

There is a big difference in how funny and how much energy the daily show 
had before 2014, and this bit was one of their best﻿

comments.text:
Pro-lifers are not a "special interest." Over half the electorate supports 
outlawing most abortions. Before Roe v Wade it was illegal in all or nearly 
all states. It is up to both Republicans and Democrats to address the human 
trafficking issue without unhelpfully tying it to controversies where 
agreement cannot be had.﻿

comments.author: kahurikuul

comments.text:
Pro-lifers are not a special interest group? In that case neither are 
provided choicers. If you are pro choice it means you HAVE A CHOICE whether 
or not to have an abortion, whereas pro-life means no choice, you have to 
carry the baby to term. You talk about percentiles and how pro-life with no 
exception and pro choice are almost equal, but acceptable in some cases is 
50%. Acceptable in some cases is pro choice. Some case could be incest, 
rape, woman's health, underage pregnancy and so forth.
comments.author: kahurikuul

comments.text:
I never denied that you need a brain to feel pain. I denied that you need a 
nine-month-old brain to feel pain. I said that  we don't really know 
exactly when the fetus can feel pain, which is correct. Now as to whether a 
child still inside the womb is a baby or only becomes a baby when the cord 
is cut, that's a question of semantics, and I think it's consistent with 
usage to call the fetus a baby for some purposes but maybe not for others. 
For example "I can feel the baby kicking" or "when is the baby due?" The 
only reason not to call an advanced fetus a baby is that you can't see it, 
which is a dumb reason. As for viability, lots of 30 year olds aren't 
viable e.g. those with spinal injuries. As for my Siamese Twins analogy 
it's not my fault if you're bad with analogies.
comments.author: DucksDeLucks

comments.text:
+biguattipoptropica So I'm a maggot eh? You liberals just ooze with human

to be a massive reaction against your whole incredibly shallow modernist 
morality. As for who "destroys" whom, how would you know? People who throw

comments.author: DucksDeLucks

comments.text:
She did actually destroy you, it was great. Also, considering Siamese twins 
don't grow inside one another and squish their organs, shut up. NO OVARIES, 
NO SAY. Every woman has a right to decide for herself you disgusting maggot 
on mankind. I wish someone's mother had an abortion *sighs* oh well. Live

comments.author: biguattipoptropica

comments.text:
+Jesse Greer Nice try, A for effort, but you did NOT destroy my 
comment. Lets go in order.
a) 1% more "pro-choice." This is contradicted by the table below it so I 
assume as a former polltaker that a lot of people aren't sure what these 
labels mean.
1. You say my Siamese twins analogy is bad. I think it's good because it's 
a case where the two people are physically connected and yet do not thereby 
gain the right to kill each other. You think its value as an analogy is 
undermined by the fact that Siamese twins sometimes can feel each other's 
pain whereas mother and fetus cannot. I don't see how this is relevant. If 
anything, shared pain would be another reason to give each rights over the 
other's body, so the abortion case would be more favorable to my contention 
that neither has a right over the other's body.
2. You note that sometimes one Siamese twin can survive without the other 
but the fetus cannot survive without the mother until late in pregnancy. I 
don't consider the ability to survive outside the womb ("viability") 
relevant to right to life. Many adults who have been injured are not viable 
without a team of surgeons but it's not okay to kill them. Newborns and 
small children cannot survive without assistance, but that's no excuse to 
kill them. The right to life would require viability only if it were 
unreasonable to ask a mother to put up with the inconvenience of pregnancy. 
Where the pregnancy results from a voluntary sex act, undertaken with the 
knowledge that pregnancy could result, it is not unreasonable. If you buy a 
dog you take on the responsibility for its well-being and similarly if you 
conceive a human. Yes I know it's lopsided that only females have this 
inconvenience but that too fails to give you the right to kill little 
females!
3. You say:Unlike Siamese twins first trimester fetuses are too undeveloped 
to think or feel pain. If that were true it would at most justify first 
trimester abortions. I tend to doubt that a fully developed brain is 
necessary to feel pain but I don't think anyone knows. I once asked a 
neurologist and he said that there's no scientific way to test what someone 
is feeling if they can't talk. btw surely a fetus is a human being. It's 
human and it's a (living) being and nothing else is needed! Personally I 
would never cause suffering to kittens in the womb or puppies etc. Why we 
make an exception for people is beyond me. If it could somehow be proved 
that first trimester babies can't experience suffering then I would drop my 
secular objections to abortion in those cases.
comments.author: DucksDeLucks

comments.text:
+DucksDeLucks Majority rule is oppressive, the founders never really wanted 
majority rule. They didn't want majority rule because then, the majority 
would be able to fringe upon the rights of the minority. This is why we 
have the House, and Senate in congress. This is why we have all the 
branches, and this is why we have Checks and Balances between them. Just 
because the majority of people want to nuke Japan, does it mean it is 
right? So, the fact that you are part of a "majority", means absolutely 
shit to politics.
comments.author: OdizzleDot S

comments.text: +Jesse Greer Sorry, I don't understand that expression.
comments.author: DucksDeLucks

comments.text:
+Jesse Greer 1) Look at the link you sent.me!!! 28% say illegal under any 
circumstances. The rest (72%) say legal only in certain circumstances (50%) 
or illegal under any circumstances (21%) with 1% no opinion. Baseless 
claims?! I'm afraid that would be you my dear. 2) The fetus is not part of 
your body in the relevant sense. Its body is connected to yours and is 
inside your womb but its brain, nervous system, feet, stomach, etc., are 
not yours. You don't feel its pain. The best analogy is "Siamese twins." 
They share a circulatory system and certain body parts but neither has the 
right to kill the other on that account. When you create a human being you 
become responsible for it, except in the case of rape. I realize that 
nature has put the greater burden on women, but we make up for it by 
exempting them from forced military service, making it taboo to hit them, 
giving them first shot at the lifeboats, etc. I agree that the word 
'murderer' should not be applied to women who have abortions. btw, you may 
have noticed that roughly equal numbers say they are pro-life and 
pro-choice. I suspect that's because these expressions are often 
misunderstood by people who don't pay close attention to politics.
comments.author: DucksDeLucks

comments.text:
+devodid 1. As far as I understood the situation they did read the initial 
bill. Then the bill was changed during deliberations. The reps gave the 
dems a list of changes but that list was incomplete. 
I don't know what your job is but in my job (I am an engineer) that is 
pretty normal. For example, when I get a new machine of any kind I read the 
manual. If the producer of that machine releases a new manual or new 
software, I don't read the entire manual again, I just read the list of 
changes.
Of course you can blame the dems for believing that the reps gave them an 
honest and complete list but...
2. How the FUCK do u "not" read your own post again before posting? You 
wrote "need" instead of "not".
comments.author: PeterK1984

I have no sympathy for people whose excuse is "Sorry, I didn't do my job 
properly".

comments.author: Darris Hawks

comments.text:
+Darris Hawks So your saying same old ass tech capable of drilling 40,230 
ft can't be applied, I find your answer odd. Once upon a time I worked as 
drill assistant and we drilled all over Eastern US for water, within reason 
anywhere on this planet you drill eventually you hit water, and the process 
to do so is exactly the same regardless how deep or how shallow said hole 
may be. But ok water is running out meanwhile no slow down in Nestle 
bottled water from CA production ok lol.
comments.author: True Patriot

comments.text:

400 miles down and the deepest we've ever been able to drill is less than 8 
miles. 
How do you propose we reach this water? There's also a lot of water in 
space which we could harvest if we could get out there.

What the hell is this, is the US system so messed up that you can just link

comments.author: SquidCaps

comments.text:
+FraggingBard wrong!

"All this does is maintain the status quo by making sure that this crime 
victims compensation fund, the funds available from that fund, are 
constrained by the same constraint that exists under all other federal 
law,"[1]

"The aim of the bill....would create a “Domestic Trafficking Victims’ Fund” 
financed by fines from crimes, with the money used to aid victims....But 
when GOP staffers began promoting the legislation, Democrats say they 
didn’t mention they had included language that would bar money from the 
fund from being used for abortions." [2]

[1] 
http://www.politico.com/story/2015/03/human-trafficking-bill-2015-115942.html

[2] 
http://www.politico.com/story/2015/03/how-abortion-politics-scuttled-a-human-trafficking-bill-116042.html
comments.author: Matt Olmedo

comments.text:
+Matt Olmedo 
Nope, it's been snuck into various bills since '76 and is wholly unrelated 
to trafficking victims. It simply withholds federal funds for abortions, to *all 
people*, although some variants of the bill have had some very specific 
exemptions. For instance, being raped, although Republicans believe that if 
a rape is real then the woman will obviously not get pregnant because god 
is special that way.

So that exemption sort of rotates in and out depending on exactly how far 
along the fuckery scale the people inserting the amendment are.
comments.author: FraggingBard

+TomDarkwulf87 "The shit they snuck in the bill is to make LEGAL abortion
